passage: John was shopping for antiques. He was trying to decide between a beautiful hand-blown glass plate and an intricately decorated steel plate. John leaned forward to examine the plates on the shelf. He briefly lost his balance and knocked into the shelf which caused the plates to fall to the floor. When the steel plate fell on the glass plate, it broke. The store attendant came rushing over, shouting at John for being so careless. John apologised profusely and promised to pay for the damages. The attendant cleaned up the mess, and told John he owed $100. John counted out the money and left the store before he could cause any more damage.

questions.prompt: How much did John have to pay in damages?

passage: Alice had spent several years working in Japan, and during that time had begun collecting ornate swords. One day, she was showing the collection to her friend, Erin. They each picked up one of the swords: Alice’s was made of steel while Erin’s was made of glass.  They hit the swords together in mock combat. When the steel sword collided with the glass sword, it broke. Erin looked mortified about what had happened, but Alice simply laughed and said “I had too many swords anyway.”

questions.prompt: Where had Alice started her sword collection?
What did Alice say to reassure Erin?

passage: Tyler was playing baseball for his High School team. His team was in the lead, but only by a small margin. It was Tyler’s turn to bat and he could feel the pressure mounting. He walked up to the plate and rested his bat on his shoulder. The pitcher hurled the ball. Tyler concentrated hard, tensed his muscles, and swung confidently.  When the baseball collided with the bat, it broke in two. It took Tyler several seconds to process what had happened. The umpire called for play to stop, while Tyler’s coach ran over to check if he was okay.

questions.prompt: Was Tyler’s team in the lead?
Who ran over to check Tyler was okay?

passage: Anna and her family were spending the day at the zoo. One of the surprising things about the zoo they were visiting was that lots of the animals were in mixed enclosures. The anteaters were living with the chimpanzees and the flamingos were in with the rhinos. Anna stopped to watch a pig and a cheetah, which were making their way across a shared enclosure. The enclosure was very large and there was plenty of space for the animals to move around inside.  The pig was running alongside the cheetah, but then it sped up and pulled ahead. Just then, Anna’s sister pulled her away to look at the koalas, which were playing with the wallabies.

questions.prompt: What type of animal shared an enclosure with the chimpanzees?
What sped up and pulled ahead?
What did Anna’s sister want to go and see?

passage: Hannah was out for a walk in the forest after a stressful day. She liked to take her mind off her problems by collecting interesting objects she found on her travels. She had found a brick that someone had painted purple, and a feather from a bird she didn’t recognise. She took the objects out and placed them on the ground to admire them. Hannah put the brick next to the feather, but the wind blew it away. She stared miserably out into the distance. She wanted to go back and collect something else but she had to get back before dark. She picked up her bag and started to head home.

questions.prompt: What did the wind blow away?
Why did Hannah have to go home?

passage: Alyssa’s friend Adam was coming over for dinner, and she had decided to make a potato curry. She had first learned the recipe from her mother, and it never failed to impress. She made a list of everything she needed: potatoes, rice, a lime, and a can of chopped tomatoes. She then went down to the store to pick everything up. She was running late by the time she got to the checkout and she packed away the items in a rush. Alyssa packed the can of tomatoes in the same bag as the lime, and on her walk home from the store it got crushed. As she was unpacking, she also realized that she had forgotten to buy chili peppers. Embarrassed, she sent a text to Adam to ask if he could pick some up on his way over.

questions.prompt: From whom did Alyssa learn the potato curry recipe?

passage: Sam was working on a building site. His job was to accept deliveries of materials, unpack them, and update the inventory. That morning, they had received two boxes which would be used in different parts of the building. One of the boxes was made of concrete and the other was made of styrofoam. He decided to put both of the boxes away at the edge of the site. Sam put the concrete box next to the styrofoam box, but the wind blew it away. He quickly ran to tell his supervisor what had happened. The supervisor was furious, and told Sam he would take the cost of redelivery out of his wages.

questions.prompt: What did the wind blow away?

passage: Chloe was a mischievous young girl who lived on a farm with her parents. Her parents had just told her that she was grounded for a whole week, and she was throwing a tantrum. She marched out of the door and down to the chicken coop, where she saw a large rock and a loose egg lying on the floor. As she approached, the chickens fled, clucking loudly. When Chloe threw the rock at the egg, it cracked. Chloe’s parents stormed out of the house after her. When they found the mess she had made, they told her she would have to wash the dishes every night that week too.

questions.prompt: What was Chloe’s punishment for making a mess?

passage: Ryan was having a terrible day. He came out of his meeting late and had to rush home to meet a friend for dinner. He went to pack up his things: his phone, his key, and his laptop. When he eventually got home, he was exhausted. Luckily his friend suggested that they order food in rather than cooking, and Ryan enjoyed the rest of his evening.

passage: Jennifer was admiring the collection of marvellous objects on her bookshelf. There was a small marble bust of Socrates, a hand-painted porcelain vase, and a piece of igneous rock from Mount Etna. Suddenly, she began to feel a rumbling all around the room: it was an earthquake! She looked on in horror as objects began to fall from shelf to shelf. When the vase fell on the rock, it broke. After a few seconds, the rumbling subsided. She darted about the house to check if anything else had been damaged. She found her bedroom lamp had fallen over, but fortunately it still seemed to be working.

questions.prompt: Who did Jennifer have a marble bust of?

passage: Lily was cooking dinner for her friends. For a starter, they were having a selection of cheeses and homemade bread; the main course was a whole roast duck; and for dessert she had prepared a lemon pie. Lily put the cheese in the oven with the bread to warm up, but by the time she came back it had melted. Although she was upset that the starter didn’t go to plan, the rest of the meal went off without a hitch. The guests were very impressed with the lemon pie in particular.

It was moving day. Ethan had been wanting to move for months, because the yard in his current place was too small. All that was left to pack was a pair of boxes. One of the boxes was made of cardboard, and the other was made of steel. The furniture was already packed into the moving van and there wasn’t much space left. Ethan put the steel box next to the cardboard box in the moving van and after an hour's drive on the bumpy road, it got crushed. He checked the rest of his belongings carefully as he unpacked the van, and found that nothing else had been damaged. Ethan tipped the van driver $40 and thanked him for all of his help.

questions.prompt: Why did Ethan want to move?
responses: To live in a nicer area

questions.prompt: How much did Ethan tip the van driver?

passage: Daniel had slept through his alarm and was in a rush to get to work. Fortunately, when he got downstairs, he realized that his wife had already prepared his lunch. She had even left a fork and a napkin on the table next to his lunchbox to remind him to take them. He was incredibly grateful, given how late he was running. Daniel packed the fork into his lunchbox along with the napkin. On his walk to work, he could hear it rattling around inside. He arrived a few minutes late for his morning meeting with his line manager. Daniel was very rarely late, and so his manager was surprised, but not upset.

Matt was trying to cross the street to get to his favorite taco place. There were no traffic lights for some distance on either side. Matt was waiting for the traffic to quiet down and give him an opportunity to dash across. Just when he thought he might have a chance, he saw a truck coming toward him from the left, and a bicycle approaching from the right. Matt gave a glum sigh and  watched the vehicles as they sped toward one another. The truck lost control and crashed into the oncoming bicycle. All that was left of it was a crushed heap of metal. Adrenaline rushed to Matt’s head as he tried to process what was going on. Before he could react, another pedestrian was already rushing over to check if everyone was okay. Fortunately nobody had been hurt.

questions.prompt: What was Matt trying to visit across the street?
Who ran over to check if anyone was hurt?

passage: Sarah was standing outside her apartment building, looking up at an open window. She had left her keys inside, and was going to try to climb up to the window. She started planning her route. She would have to pull herself up using a drainpipe on one side and a window ledge on the other. Her apartment was only on the second floor: even if she fell she was sure she would be okay. Sarah tried to climb up the wall, with one hand on the window ledge and the other on the drainpipe, but it gave way. She lost her balance and fell to the ground. Luckily she landed on her feet, and the fall wasn’t too hard. She brushed herself off. She felt silly for being so foolish, but she was glad she was okay.

questions.prompt: What floor was Sarah’s apartment on?

passage: Charlotte was going away on a weekend trip to Cabo. She had decided to bring a couple of summer dresses to wear while she was there, a shirt and a pair of jeans for the flight home, and a book to read on the beach. She was going to meet her friend, Laura, at the hotel when she arrived. Charlotte packed her shirt in the same suitcase as her book. When she took it out, it was creased. She left her bag in her hotel room and went out for a walk along the beach. The late evening sun cast a gorgeous light on the white stone of the houses.

questions.prompt: Where was Charlotte going away to?
Who was Charlotte planning to meet?

passage: Noah was out at the arcade with his friends. It was starting to get late and he was playing tennis early the next day. He decided it was time to leave. He made sure to collect all of his belongings: his phone, his coins, and his keys. He said farewell to his friends and started to head home. Noah put his keys away in his pocket with his coins, but on his walk home they made a hole in the lining. He was annoyed when he found the hole. He resolved to mend it before he went out the next day.

questions.prompt: What was Noah planning to play the following day?
What made a hole in the lining?
What did Noah resolve to do the next day?

passage: Josh and Paula were playing tennis at their local club. Paula was about to serve, and Josh was completely unprepared, looking down at his phone. Paula began her wind-up and tossed the ball in the air. Josh looked up and was startled. He hurried to get the racquet in front of his body.  Paula smashed a serve directly at him as he tried to shield himself. When the racquet collided with the tennis ball, it bounced back and hit Josh in the face. Josh clutched at his nose and groaned in pain. Paula rushed over to check that he was okay.

questions.prompt: What hit Josh in the face?

passage: It was lunchtime, and Natalie decided to get out of the office for an hour and eat in the park. She picked up her lunch and put her phone and a chocolate bar away in her pocket. The park was busy with other people milling around and enjoying the weather. She found a spot to sit down and began to eat her lunch. Natalie regretted putting the chocolate bar in her pocket with her phone: when she took it out, it had melted.  She was quite taken aback and upset. When she finished eating, she spotted a stand selling hotdogs and soda. She was feeling incredibly thirsty and she bought a lemonade, which she drank on her way back to the office.

questions.prompt: Where did Natalie go to eat her lunch?

passage: Alice was running late for a hair appointment. As she was looking for her wallet, she spotted a bunch of bananas on the kitchen table. She hadn’t had time to eat lunch, and she was starting to get hungry. Alice stuffed a banana in her pocket with her wallet. When she took it out, it was squashed. She slumped into a chair in the waiting room, feeling annoyed. Fortunately, she was only a few minutes late for her appointment, and the previous customer was just getting ready to pay.

questions.prompt: What sort of appointment was Alice on her way to?
